verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Standard introductory phrase for direct communication from God to Moses.

verses.text: Speak to the people of Israel, that they take a contribution for me. From every man whose heart moves him you shall take my contribution.
verses.comment: The Hebrew word for 'contribution' is 'terumah', meaning an offering lifted up.

verses.text: And this is the contribution that you shall take from them: gold, silver, and bronze,
verses.comment: Materials listed for the tabernacle construction.

verses.text: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, fine linen, goats’ hair,
verses.comment: The Hebrew colors are based on dyes from shellfish and insects.

verses.text: tanned ram skins, goat skins, acacia wood,
verses.comment: Translation of 'tanned ram skins' and 'goat skins' follows best modern understandings.

verses.text: oil for the lamp, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
verses.comment: These items will be used for lampstand, anointing oil, and incense.

verses.text: onyx stones, and stones for setting, for the ephod and for the breastpiece.
verses.comment: 'Ephod' and 'breastpiece' are priestly garments, described later in Exodus.

verses.text: And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell among them.
verses.comment: 'Sanctuary' here specifically refers to the tabernacle.

verses.text: Exactly as I show you concerning the pattern of the tabernacle, and of all its furnishings, so you shall make it.
verses.comment: The word 'pattern' here suggests a heavenly model, as referenced in Heb. 8:5.

verses.text: They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Two and a half cubits shall be its length, a cubit and a half its width, and a cubit and a half its height.
verses.comment: A cubit is about 18 inches (45 cm).

verses.text: Overlay it with pure gold, inside and out you shall overlay it, and make a molding of gold around it.
verses.comment: Pure gold is repeatedly emphasized for the holy objects.

verses.text: You shall cast four rings of gold for it and put them on its four feet, two rings on one side of it, and two rings on the other side of it.
verses.comment: The rings were for transporting the ark with poles.

verses.text: You shall make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
verses.comment: Acacia wood is durable and abundant in the region.

verses.text: And you shall put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark to carry the ark by them.
verses.comment: The ark was transported without touching it directly.

verses.text: The poles shall remain in the rings of the ark; they shall not be removed from it.
verses.comment: For ritual purity, the ark was not to be touched.

verses.text: You shall put into the ark the testimony that I shall give you.
verses.comment: 'Testimony' refers to the tablets of the covenant.

verses.text: You shall make a mercy seat of pure gold. Two and a half cubits shall be its length, and a cubit and a half its width.
verses.comment: 'Mercy seat' translates Hebrew 'kapporet', the cover for the ark.

verses.text: And you shall make two cherubim of gold. Of hammered work you shall make them at the two ends of the mercy seat.
verses.comment: Cherubim are angelic beings, not clearly described in the Hebrew.

verses.text: Make one cherub at one end, and one cherub at the other end. Of one piece with the mercy seat shall you make the cherubim at its two ends.
verses.comment: The cherubim and the gold cover are a single piece.

verses.text: The cherubim shall spread out their wings above, overshadowing the mercy seat with their wings. Their faces shall face one another; toward the mercy seat shall the faces of the cherubim be.
verses.comment: The details emphasize reverence and the sacredness of the ark.

verses.text: You shall put the mercy seat on top of the ark, and in the ark you shall put the testimony that I will give you.
verses.comment: Repeats the instruction for clarity and emphasis.

verses.text: There I will meet with you, and from above the mercy seat, from between the two cherubim that are on the ark of the testimony, I will speak with you about all that I will command you for the people of Israel.
verses.comment: The mercy seat is regarded as the meeting place between God and Moses.

verses.text: You shall make a table of acacia wood. Two cubits shall be its length, one cubit its width, and one and a half cubits its height.
verses.comment: About 3 feet by 1.5 feet by 2.25 feet (90 x 45 x 68 cm).

verses.text: Overlay it with pure gold and make a molding of gold around it.
verses.comment: Pure gold again stresses its sanctity.

verses.text: And you shall make a rim around it, a handbreadth wide, and a gold molding around the rim.
verses.comment: A handbreadth is about 3 inches (8 cm).

verses.text: And you shall make four rings of gold for the table and fasten the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
verses.comment: Rings allow portability, as with the ark.

verses.text: The rings shall be close to the frame as holders for the poles to carry the table.
verses.comment: Instructions for mobility during the wanderings.

verses.text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold, so that the table may be carried with them.
verses.comment: Consistent material choices for holy furnishings.

verses.text: You shall make its plates and dishes for incense, its flagons and bowls with which to pour drink offerings; you shall make them of pure gold.
verses.comment: Flagons likely refer to pitchers for drink offerings.

verses.text: And you shall set the showbread on the table before me always.
verses.comment: 'Showbread' is literally 'bread of the presence.'

verses.text: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. The lampstand shall be made of hammered work: its base, its shaft, its cups, its bulbs, and its flowers shall be of one piece with it.
verses.comment: 'Bulbs' are likely decorative cups shaped like almond blossoms.

verses.text: There shall be six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side.
verses.comment: The menorah had seven lamps: one central, six on branches.

verses.text: Three cups shaped like almond blossoms on one branch, with bulb and flower; and three cups shaped like almond blossoms on the other branch, with bulb and flower—the same for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
verses.comment: Almond blossom was a common decorative motif.

verses.text: In the lampstand itself there shall be four cups shaped like almond blossoms, with bulbs and flowers,
verses.comment: The central shaft had its own decorations.

verses.text: and a bulb under the first pair of branches, a bulb under the second pair of branches, and a bulb under the third pair of branches, a total of six branches going out from the lampstand.
verses.comment: The bulbs separate the branches.

verses.text: Their bulbs and their branches shall be of one piece with it; the whole of it shall be one hammered piece of pure gold.
verses.comment: Precision emphasizes the holiness and unity of the menorah.

verses.text: And you shall make its seven lamps. And the lamps shall be set up so as to give light ahead of it.
verses.comment: Seven lamps for completeness and symbolic light.

verses.text: Its tongs and its trays shall be of pure gold.
verses.comment: 'Tongs' for trimming wicks; trays for collecting debris.

verses.text: It shall be made of a talent of pure gold, with all these utensils.
verses.comment: A talent is approximately 75 pounds or 34 kilograms.

verses.text: And see that you make them after the pattern for them, which is being shown you on the mountain.
verses.comment: Emphasizes that Moses' instructions reflect a heavenly ideal; see Heb. 8:5.
